moves.1. d4: d4,probably the 2nd most common opening in chess
moves.2. Bf4: bishop opening of an interesting and dangerous kind
moves.2... Bd7: that was a little stupid and odd on my part i tihnk i'm too paranoid that the knight is going come hop on over to b5
moves.3. Nc3: well he's hopping alright , to the now unprotected pawn
moves.4. e4: challenging for the center of wihch I have next to no control
moves.4... Nf6: not wise i totally space advance to e5
moves.5. e5: yep, that's what i would have done too
moves.5... Ng8: retreat, better probably is Ne4  because it at least allows development and potential castling
moves.6... c6: ????Why didn't i take. Bxb5, Nxb5, Qd7, now i bet i know why i lost
moves.9. Nf3: developing to castle, i'm not even close yet
moves.9... c5: let's force the center open where my king is sitting stupdily, ok
moves.10... c4: brilliance, finally something i did right
moves.11. Bg5: oh if it wasn't for that
moves.11... f6: NO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!What on earth was I thinking, that totally exposes me, i should of just blocked with the bishop or knight
moves.13... Bxb5: i get his knight at the cost of exposure
moves.14... Nc6: developing finally, but into what castle?
moves.17. b3: here comes the tornado of pawns
moves.17... a5: trouble looking probable for the future
moves.19. Rb1: and my problems begin even though i'm up in material, i'm a dead man
moves.23. Rb3: chasing me back into the foxhole
moves.24. Qh5: and the full on attack begins
moves.25. Rfb1: more problems i wonder if i saw Rxb7, Qxb7, Rxb7, Kxb7,Qxe8
moves.25... Rd8: ok first thing i did right, although there is probably better, at least i saw the basic level blunder
moves.26... Qe8: depserately trying to exchange the queens
moves.27... f5: best i got not that it's going to be good enough, LOL, I have 6 pieces on the back rank, undeveloped and he's got 2 , one of which is assisting in the battery up my back side
moves.31. Bxe6+: NO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I missed that twice now, once annotating and once playing, i resign here, the follow up is of course... Rd7, Bxd7+,Kd8 and then Rb8 checkmate, or Qxd7, followed by Rxd7, and then eventually defeat. Good game Moru, I'll have to play a better one next time, because that was lousy on my part.I was Going Nowhere Fast there, LOL. Until we meet again, muhhahhhhhh!!!!!!!!
